title: COVID-19, Understanding Quarantine and Isolation - Quarantine Isolation What does it
publisher: United States of America : New York, New York.
description: Who does not need to quarantine, and what precautions should they take? You do not need to quarantine if you either: • Are up to date with your vaccines • Had COVID-19 in the last 90 days (as confirmed by a positive viral test) o 90 days is from when you first had COVID-19 symptoms or, if you had no symptoms, the date of your first positive test. [...] You should get tested at least five days after your last close contact with the person who has COVID-19 or right away if you develop COVID-19 symptoms: • If your test result is negative or you are unable to get tested, you can end quarantine after Day 5. [...] What prevention measures should I follow during quarantine and after quarantine ends? For 10 days after your last close contact with someone who has COVID-19, even if you end quarantine sooner, you should: • Monitor for COVID-19 symptoms and get tested and isolate if symptoms develop. [...] If you must travel, you should: o Not do so during your five-day quarantine period o Not do so until 10 days after your last close contact if you cannot get tested o Get tested at least five days after your last close contact, receive a negative test result and have no symptoms for all five days of quarantine before doing so o Wear a well-fitting mask around others for the entire 10 days. [...] Do I have to quarantine too? Isolation Who needs to isolate, and for how long? Do I need to get tested for COVID-19 to end isolation? How to Protect Yourself and Others How do I monitor my health? How can I protect others in my household during and after quarantine or isolation? What mask should I wear after a close contact, testing positive for COVID-19 or having symptoms? What if I do not have a.
